comments.text:
Currently, our readyState code is rather flaky for anything but regular HTML and XML docs. It's flaky for XSLT, image docs, video docs, plug-in docs and XUL. They don't have their readyState set to "interactive" right before the readyState turns to "complete".

To make code that inspects readyState work correctly in all cases and to make it easier to catch bugs introduced to page loading code, I think we should make all documents that end up firing the load event progress through "loading", "interactive" and "complete" and we should make the readyState changes assert the previous readyState right before the state change.
